info.title: Transportation Microservice
info.description: The Transportation Microservice is responsible for public transportation schedules and associated geographic information. The microservice provides endpoints for creating, retrieving, updating and deleting agencies, stops, routes, trips, fares and other objects.

tags.name: stop-times
tags.description: Stop times are times that a vehicle arrives at and departs from individual stops for each trip.

tags.name: transfers
tags.description: Transfers describe rules for making connections at transfer points between routes.

tags.name: routes
tags.description: A route is a group of trips that are displayed to riders as a single service.

tags.name: fares
tags.description: Fare objects stores fare information for transit routes.

tags.name: trips
tags.description: A trip is a sequence of two or more stops that occurs at specific time.

tags.name: stops
tags.description: Stops are individual locations where vehicles pick up or drop off passengers.

tags.name: service-dates
tags.description: Service dates are exceptional dates when the route is active or disabled.

tags.name: shape-points
tags.description: Shape points are points of a shape on the map to represent transit routes.

tags.name: fare-rules
tags.description: Fare rules are rules for applying fare information for a transit route.

tags.name: agencies
tags.description: Agencies provide data in the feed.

tags.name: services
tags.description: Services represent days and dates when a route is active.

tags.name: shapes
tags.description: Shapes are rules for drawing lines on the map to represent transit routes.

tags.name: blocks
tags.description: A block consists of a single trip or many sequential trips made using the same vehicle.

tags.name: feeds
tags.description: A feed object contains information about the feed itself, including publisher, version, and expiration information.

get.description: The `drop-off-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that indicate how passengers are dropped off.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `pickup-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that indicate how passengers are picked up.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `transfer-types` endpoint allows you to list all existing transfer types.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `route-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that describe types of transportation used on a route.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `payment-method-types` endpoint allows you to list payment method codes used to indicate when the fare is paid.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `wheelchair-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that indicate if there are accommodations for riders with wheelchairs.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `wheelchair-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that identify whether wheelchair boardings are possible from the specified stop, station, or station entrance.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `location-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that indicate whether this stop ID represents a stop or station.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `transfer-types` endpoint allows you to list transfer type codes which indicate if the transfer is permitted.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `bike-types` endpoint allows you to list codes that indicate if bicycles are allowed.

200.description: The endpoint returns an object containing pairs of codes and their meanings.

get.description: The `service-dates` endpoint allows you to list all existing service date objects.

200.description: The endpoint returns a paginated list of items along with page number, the number of items per page and the total number of records.

get.description: The `agencies` endpoint allows you to list all existing agency objects.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Sorts the results by the specified field(s). To sort in descending order, add a minus sign before the field name. To sort by several fields, list the fields separating them by commas.

get.description: The `stops` endpoint allows you to list all existing stop objects.

200.description: The endpoint returns a paginated list of items along with page number, the number of items per page and the total number of records.

parameters.name: feed
parameters.description: Restricts the results to stops assigned to the specified feed. Indicate a feed codename or list feed codenames separating them by commas.

parameters.name: feed_id
parameters.description: Restricts the results to stops assigned to the specified feed. Indicate a feed ID or list feed IDs separating them by commas.

parameters.name: agency
parameters.description: Restricts the results to stops assigned to the specified agency. Indicate an `agency_id` or list `agency_id`s separating them by commas.

parameters.name: agency_id
parameters.description: Restricts the results to stops assigned to the specified agency. Indicate an agency ID or list agency IDs separating them by commas.

parameters.name: route
parameters.description: Restricts the results to stops assigned to the specified route. Indicate a `route_id` or list `route_id`s separating them by commas.

parameters.name: route_id
parameters.description: Restricts the results to stops assigned to the specified route. Indicate a route ID or list route IDs separating them by commas.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The number of page to return.

parameters.name: paginate_by
parameters.description: A number of items per page to return.

parameters.name: ordering
parameters.description: Sorts the results by the specified field(s). To sort in descending order, add a minus sign before the field name. To sort by several fields, list the fields separating them by commas.

arrival_time.description: The arrival time at a specific Stop for a specific Trip on a Route. Must be set for end Stops of the Trip (in seconds from 00:00).
arrival_time.title: arrival_time

departure_time.description: The departure time from a specific Stop for a specific Trip on a Route. Must be set for end Stops of the Trip (in seconds from 00:00).
departure_time.title: departure_time

stop_sequence.description: The order of Stops in a particular Trip.
stop_sequence.title: stop_sequence

stop_headsign.description: The text that appears on a sign that identifies the Trip’s destination to passengers.
stop_headsign.title: stop_headsign

pickup_type.description: The code that indicates how passengers are picked up. Use the ’pickup-types’ endpoint to list the codes.
pickup_type.title: pickup_type

drop_off_type.description: The code that indicates how passengers are dropped off. Use the ’stop-times’ endpoint to list the codes.
drop_off_type.title: drop_off_type

shape_dist_traveled.description: A real distance traveled along the Route from the start of the shape.
shape_dist_traveled.title: shape_dist_traveled

parameters.description: The ID of the requested stop time object.

put.summary: Update a stop time by ID

200.description: The updated stop time object is returned

parameters.description: The ID of the stop time to update.

stop_sequence.description: A new number representing the stop sequence. Or the old value if not to update.

stop.description: A new stop ID. Or the old value if not to update.

trip.description: A new trip ID. Or the old value if not to update.

min_transfer_time.description: New time required to transfer (in seconds).

arrival_time.description: New arrival time. Must be set for end stops of the trip (in seconds).

departure_time.description: New departure time. Must be set for end stops of the trip (in seconds).

stop_headsign.description: A new title to identify the stop for passengers.

pickup_type.description: A new code to specify how passengers are picked up.

drop_off_type.description: A new code to specify how passengers are dropped off.

shape_dist_traveled.description: A new distance of the stop from the start of the shape.

patch.summary: Partially update a stop time by ID

parameters.name: id

route.description: A new route ID. Or the old value if not to update.

trip_id.description: A new description of the trip. Or the old value if not to update.

shape.description: A new shape ID.

block.description: A new ID of the block of sequential trips that this trip belongs to.

headsign.description: A new destination identification for passengers.

short_name.description: A new short name used in schedules and signboards.

direction.description: A new direction for bi-directional routes. Can be "0" or "1".

wheelchair_accessible.description: A new code that indicates if there are accommodations for riders with wheelchairs.

bike_allowed.description: A new code that indicates if bicycles are allowed.
